TITLE: A New Area of A.I. Booms, Even Amid the Tech Gloom
SUMMARY: An investment frenzy over “generative artificial intelligence” has gripped Silicon Valley, as tools that generate text, images and sounds in response to short prompts seize the imagination.

TITLE: FTC Chair Lina Khan on the Problems with Noncompetes
SUMMARY: The chairwoman of the F.T.C. argues in favor of a proposal to eliminate noncompete clauses from employee contracts.

TITLE: After a Burst of New Businesses, a Cooling Economy Intrudes
SUMMARY: The pandemic has brought a boom in entrepreneurship, but higher interest rates, a chill in venture capital and fears of recession now pose obstacles.

TITLE: Entrepreneurs Flee China’s Heavy Hand: ‘You Don’t Have to Stay There’
SUMMARY: Weary of crackdowns and lockdowns, businesspeople are moving out of China and taking their wealth with them. Many have found a new home in Singapore.

TITLE: 6 Podcasts to Help Navigate Your Career Path
SUMMARY: Check out these shows whether you’re looking to start a business, pivot to a new industry or just better handle office politics.

TITLE: How Waze Changed the Way We Drive
SUMMARY: A new book by the company’s co-founder Uri Levine offers lessons on succeeding as an entrepreneur.

TITLE: Anthropic Said to Be Closing In on $300 Million in New A.I. Funding
SUMMARY: Anthropic specializes in generative artificial intelligence, a hot investment in Silicon Valley. The new funding could value the company at roughly $5 billion.

TITLE: ‘Recession Resilient’ Climate Start-Ups Shine in Tech Downturn
SUMMARY: Tech workers and investors are flocking to start-ups that aim to combat climate change.

TITLE: Why Grandma’s Nutrition Drink Is So Hard to Disrupt
SUMMARY: Upstarts have tried, and mostly failed, to compete with shakes like Ensure and Boost. They say the brands’ ties to health care providers make it tough.

TITLE: Selling Trump Isn’t What It Used to Be
SUMMARY: Donald Trump has reunited with a former business partner to sell online trading cards, hoping to recreate a once-profitable mix of hype and celebrity. Initial sales hint at how difficult that will be in 2023.

TITLE: Marianne Mantell, Who Helped Pave the Way for Audiobooks, Dies at 93
SUMMARY: In her early 20s she co-founded the groundbreaking spoken-word record label Caedmon, which had a hit with Dylan Thomas’s “A Child’s Christmas in Wales.”

TITLE: A Watch Dealing Mogul, at 19
SUMMARY: Linden Lazarus has spent most of his teen years selling timepieces. Now, he has employees to help out.

SUMMARY: A Texas entrepreneur, he co-founded the media giant Clear Channel, owned pro sports teams and created more than 400 businesses in a variety of industries.

TITLE: Tech Leaders in Israel Wonder if It’s Time to Leave
SUMMARY: Ahead of a judicial overhaul that could transform the country and frighten away investors, the executives of Start-Up Nation are mulling an exodus.

TITLE: After Bank Debacle, Silicon Valley Reckons With Its Image
SUMMARY: Even as start-ups and investors began recovering their money from Silicon Valley Bank, the episode exposed the tech industry’s vulnerabilities.

SUMMARY: In just weeks, a gold rush into artificial intelligence start-ups has become a full-blown mania.

TITLE: Silicon Valley Bank’s Deep Ties to the Tech Industry
SUMMARY: More than many other banks, SVB catered to how risky tech start-ups and their backers do not adhere to normal business practices.

TITLE: Crypto Wants Its Shine Back
SUMMARY: After a miserable year, cryptocurrency companies are looking for ways to rebrand products that many consumers no longer trust.

TITLE: Lindsay Lohan and Jake Paul Among Crypto Endorsers Charged by SEC
SUMMARY: The agency charged Justin Sun with violations of securities law in a scheme involving the actress Lindsay Lohan and other celebrities.

TITLE: When Your Career, and Retirement, Are the Family’s Business
SUMMARY: Succession plans, or the lack thereof, can hinder the transition to a new generation — and affect how loved ones fund their later years.

TITLE: Gordon E. Moore, Intel Co-Founder Behind Moore’s Law, Dies at 94
SUMMARY: His prediction in the 1960s about rapid advances in computer chip technology charted a course for the age of high tech.

TITLE: Silicon Valley Bank’s Collapse Chills Start-Up Funding
SUMMARY: Two weeks after the bank failed, the fallout has hit the start-up market as investors pull back further and fear has risen.

TITLE: Turmoil at ‘Chief’ Raises the Question: Is Empowering Corporate Women Enough?
SUMMARY: Turmoil at Chief, a women’s networking organization, raises a long-simmering question: Is amassing power for corporate women a worthy goal in itself?

TITLE: Lesbian Bars in Los Angeles Change With the Times
SUMMARY: Two recent openings testify to the power, and joy, of queer spaces.

TITLE: How Small Businesses Can Find Safety Before the Next Bank Crisis
SUMMARY: Financial advisers recommend that business owners examine their accounts now to ensure they are protected in case of a future bank failure.

TITLE: How African Restaurant Baobab Fare Found Success in Detroit
SUMMARY: Hamissi Mamba, a refugee from Burundi, knew little of American culture when he arrived eight years ago and learned English watching the “Peppa Pig” cartoon. But he opened his dream restaurant, and the accolades have rolled in.

SUMMARY: As the wine industry flagged in its commitment to Black and brown communities, this consultant forged his own path.

SUMMARY: An entrepreneur said a rival olive oil start-up ripped off his big idea.

SUMMARY: Precious Price ditched her profitable business  of renting home stays to tourists to combat the mounting housing crisis.

SUMMARY: Few are as involved in so many different artificial intelligence efforts as Mr. Hoffman, a Silicon Valley investor who co-founded LinkedIn.

SUMMARY: In Silicon Valley’s hacker houses, the latest crop of young entrepreneurs is partying, innovating — and hoping not to get crushed by the big guys.

SUMMARY: The disgraced founder of the blood testing start-up Theranos, who was convicted of fraud, turned herself in at a minimum-security prison in Texas.

SUMMARY: Ahead of a judicial overhaul that could transform the country and frighten away investors, the executives of Start-Up Nation are mulling an exodus.

TITLE: The AI Boom Is Pulling Tech Entrepreneurs Back to San Francisco
SUMMARY: Tech entrepreneurs who left the Bay Area during the pandemic say they can’t afford to miss out on the funding, hackathons and networking of the artificial intelligence frenzy.

TITLE: Pivots That Helped Businesses Through the Pandemic Have Endured
SUMMARY: A challenging time proved to be fertile ground for experimentation that continues to pay off.

SUMMARY: Candle makers offer tie-ins with whiffs of ginger, warm woods and bergamot. Sniff, sniff, sniff.

SUMMARY: The implosion of Three Arrows Capital, a cryptocurrency hedge fund, devastated the industry. Its two founders spent the next year surfing, meditating and traveling the world.

SUMMARY: More than many other banks, SVB catered to how risky tech start-ups and their backers do not adhere to normal business practices.

SUMMARY: The National Labor Relations Board, with a Democratic majority, restored a standard that counts more workers as employees rather than contractors.

SUMMARY: The Brooklyn-based ice cream chain boomed with the help of Oprah and Disney, then went bust. But the couple behind it are opening new shops and thinking small.

SUMMARY: Across the U.S., Asian beer makers are putting their mark on an industry that is still predominantly white.

SUMMARY: The owners of Lanoba, a shop that specializes in Danish modern design, find most pieces by going door to door.

TITLE: Where Does New York City Office Furniture Go When No One Wants It?
SUMMARY: Some office furniture in the metro area has been caught in pandemic limbo. What awaits it in the afterlife?

SUMMARY: The pandemic accelerated a transition to cashless payments, forcing a reckoning among small-business owners. But there are benefits: An owner said one cashless system saved her $3,000 a month.

SUMMARY: The wholesome summer favorite is catching on in the U.S., but with sprinkles, drizzles and even cookies to satisfy the nation’s sweet tooth.

SUMMARY: The government’s new 31-point guidelines meant to inspire confidence feel empty to businesspeople after a three-year clampdown and no concrete changes.

SUMMARY: The “bouquinistes” along the River Seine have objected after being told that most of them will have to move temporarily for security reasons.

SUMMARY: In Montana, a stretch of U.S. Highway 2 known as the Hi-Line is colored by grain elevators, railroad cars and century-old homesteading remnants.

SUMMARY: A new study found that workers often don’t understand equity compensation, exposing them to exploitation.

SUMMARY: Consumers and businesses are losing confidence in Xi Jinping’s government.

SUMMARY: Few are as involved in so many different artificial intelligence efforts as Mr. Hoffman, a Silicon Valley investor who co-founded LinkedIn.

TITLE: Samuel Wurzelbacher, Celebrated as ‘Joe the Plumber,’ Dies at 49
SUMMARY: For Republicans in 2008, he briefly became a symbol of Middle America when he questioned the presidential candidate Barack Obama in a televised encounter.

SUMMARY: A company that rode to success with an inclusive message has shrunk to a single store, as a founder sues a partner he accuses of mismanagement and fraud.

SUMMARY: Everyone loves a bargain. But can anyone survive the entirety of the 127 Yard Sale, an annual four-day event that stretches from Michigan to Alabama?

SUMMARY: Shedding its stodgy image, the city has become a destination for start-ups looking for cheaper space and younger workers on the hunt for roomier housing.

SUMMARY: As the city’s affordability crisis worsens for nearly everyone, even upper-middle-class New Yorkers are struggling to pay for child care. The workers who provide it are struggling too.

SUMMARY: An airy boutique for salves and cosmetics was a Brooklyn hot spot for more than a decade. But many employees described an ugly workplace.

SUMMARY: The Babel sisters closed their beloved cocktail bar and brought its vibes to a new spot for a fee. To them, the time was right.

SUMMARY: Everyone who relies on credit in America is confronting a new reality: Money will cost more for a good long while.

SUMMARY: The owners of Lanoba, a shop that specializes in Danish modern design, find most pieces by going door to door.

TITLE: Here’s Why a New York City Lobster Roll (With Fries!) Costs $32
SUMMARY: The pandemic upended everything at the Red Hook Lobster Pound. By mid-2022, the co-founder felt she had no choice but to raise the price of her signature item, a lobster roll and fries.

SUMMARY: The departure of the high-profile boss of the San Francisco company drew attention to a philosophical rift among the people building new A.I. systems.

SUMMARY: Thirty years after starting What Goes Around Comes Around, Gerard Maione and Seth Weisser are still on the hunt for lost classics from Hermès, Chanel and Levi’s.

SUMMARY: After staving off collapse by cutting costs, many young tech companies are out of options, fueling a cash bonfire.

TITLE: Retail Group Retracts Startling Claim About ‘Organized’ Shoplifting
SUMMARY: The National Retail Federation had said that nearly half of the industry’s $94.5 billion in missing merchandise in 2021 was the result of organized theft. It was likely closer to 5 percent, experts say.

SUMMARY: Este ha sido el año más difícil para el sector en una década, según los expertos. En Silicon Valley, las nuevas empresas tecnológicas con más negocio son las que ayudan a otras a finiquitar sus operaciones.

SUMMARY: Trevor Milton, who founded the truck company Nikola, was sentenced on Monday in a fraud case that exposed the excesses in the electric vehicle business.

TITLE: It Took 10 Years to Grow This Christmas Tree. The Price? $105

SUMMARY: In a fractious era, tea salons provide an oasis.

TITLE: Angelina Jolie and the Ghosts of New York Past
SUMMARY: Her new store, Atelier Jolie, occupies an unassuming building on Great Jones Street with an illustrious history.
